private_information: My meetings on Monday are: 13:00 to 13:30, 16:00 to 16:30.
brittany_scheduler.goal: Identify my available time slots for a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00.

private_information: I am free the entire day (9:00 to 17:00) on Monday.
emily_scheduler.goal: Identify my available time slots for a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00.

private_information: My busy periods on Monday are: 9:00 to 11:00, 11:30 to 14:30, 15:00 to 17:00.
doris_scheduler.goal: Identify my available time slots for a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00.

auditor.goal: Review the input schedules for temporal consistency and format standardization before orchestration.

orchestrator.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting for Brittany, Emily, and Doris on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00 at the earliest possible time, respecting all existing schedules.

public_information: A 30-minute meeting must be scheduled on Monday.
The meeting must occur between 9:00 and 17:00.
The goal is to find the earliest possible starting time that works for everyone.

schedule_analysis.system_prompt: You are an expert scheduler. Analyze the constraints and your personal schedule to determine all possible 30-minute meeting slots on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00. Output the list of available start times in the format HH:MM, enclosed in <schedule></schedule> tags.

You are an expert scheduler. Analyze the constraints and your personal schedule to determine all possible 30-minute meeting slots on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00. Output the list of available start times in the format HH:MM, enclosed in <schedule></schedule> tags.

You are an expert scheduler. Analyze the constraints and your personal schedule to determine all possible 30-minute meeting slots on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00. Output the list of available start times in the format HH:MM, enclosed in <schedule></schedule> tags.

consistency_check.system_prompt: You are a temporal consistency checker and formatter. You receive schedule data from multiple agents. Your task is to verify that the time slots are consistent, resolve any formatting issues (e.g., ensuring all times adhere to 30-minute intervals starting at 9:00), and combine them into a single, standardized structure ready for the orchestrator. Do not attempt to solve the scheduling conflict, only standardize the input.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems (Planning Domain Definition Language) specialized in constraint satisfaction and scheduling. You must model the scheduling problem using the provided standardized input and constraints (30-minute duration, 9:00-17:00 window, finding the earliest time). You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task, targeting FastDownwards solver. You always enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
